place.name: RADSTONE
place.gazetteerText: RADSTONE, a parish in Brackley district, Northampton; 2¾ miles N of Brackley r. station. Post-town, Brackley. Acres, 810. Real property, £1, 425. Pop., 168. Houses, 46. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to the Rev.W. Holbeck. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £118. Patron, the Rev.W. Holbeck. The church is ancient; was recently restored; and has a low Saxon tower, and a Norman font. There is an endowed school with £20 a year. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
